column4: hi, i have some problems with the new gutsy-release. on one of my computers i installed it on firefox hangs when i start it after an upgrade. on the other computer the internet doesn't work, the connection is wired. anyone know how to sole any of these things?
Let's start with the connection
What does network manager applet say about the connection?
it just say ip: 0.0.0.0
Could it be the router giving it the wrong address?
i'm not sure but don't think so because i get a connection when i switch to windows that i have installed on the same computer, and on my laptop with ubuntu it works
OK, try going to system > administration > networking
Open the properties of your wired connection and disable roaming mode
It should work then, but you won't be able to use the network-manager applet.
done
OK, is the device eth0 ?
sorry, got disconnected so i didint see what you wrote
I asked if the device you are having problems with is eth0
thats right its eth0
OK, open a terminal and run the command "sudo ifdown eth0"
ifdown: interface eth0 not configured it says
OK now run "sudo ifup eth0"
It will give you some output, just check if it binds you to a good IP.
hmm, it seems my internet is working now, i got an ipadress
There we go, it should just work from now on
ahh, thanks :)
But we have set it to manually configured, so network-manager wont work. This will be fine if you don't intend to swap your network often
